ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.phase2

Class PathFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.phase2.PathFinder

  • public class PathFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of the A* path finding algorithm which only allows cardinal movements on the map
    Author:
    yp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  PathFinder.Square
      class used to represent the squares used in the map for A* path finding
      static class  PathFinder.tileType
      type of the tile

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static boolean[][] closed
      array to record which squares on the map have been visited
      private static int Corner 
      private static boolean goingHome
      boolean to avoid obstacle avoidance during returning trip
      static double launchAdjustment
      distance adjustment of the current launch point.
      static double launchAngle
      launch angle of the current launch point
      private static int launchIndex
      index of the current launch point in the list
      static java.util.ArrayList<double[]> launchPoints
      list of at most 3 possible launch points
      private static PathFinder.Square[][] map
      a 2-D array used to represent the map
      private static java.util.PriorityQueue<PathFinder.Square> open
      priority queue used in the A* algorithm
      private static int targetX
      current target X coordinate
      private static int targetY
      target Y coordinate

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void checkAndUpdateCost(PathFinder.Square current, PathFinder.Square target, double cost)
      this checks the heuristic cost of an adjacent square, updates the final cost and adds it into the priority queue
      private static java.util.ArrayList<double[]> findLaunchPointToTarget(int targetX, int targetY)
      find a list of launch points, out of 24 possible ones in total, which can aim at the launch point
      static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> findPath()
      runs the A* algorithm and finds the shortest path to target using only cardinal movements
      static boolean isAdjacentToObstacle(int x, int y)
      checks whether a tile is adjacent to an obstacle on the West, South or Southwest tiles
      static boolean isFacingAWall()
      whether the robot is directly facing a wall
      static void letsGoHome()
      resets target to home corner
      void printMap()
      prints the map for debugging
      static void resetLaunchPoint()
      resets the launch point to another which is not adjacent (lower left) to an obstacle
      static void resetMap()
      resets the map so that a new round of path finding can be run
      static boolean setObstacle()
      set the target square in front of the robot as an obstacle
      static void setTarget(int x, int y)
      reset the target tile of PATHFINDER (differs from the navigation target, which is the next tile)

    • Method Detail

      • resetMap

        public static void resetMap()
        resets the map so that a new round of path finding can be run

      • setObstacle

        public static boolean setObstacle()
        set the target square in front of the robot as an obstacle

      • checkAndUpdateCost

        public static void checkAndUpdateCost(PathFinder.Square current,
                      PathFinder.Square target,
                      double cost)
        this checks the heuristic cost of an adjacent square, updates the final cost and adds it into the priority queue
        Parameters:
        current - current square probing from
        target - square being probed
        cost - cost increment of the target

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        prints the map for debugging

      • findPath

        public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> findPath()
        runs the A* algorithm and finds the shortest path to target using only cardinal movements
        Returns:
        a list of int[] of size 2, which represents the list of squares the robot should move to in order to reach to the target

      • findLaunchPointToTarget

        private static java.util.ArrayList<double[]> findLaunchPointToTarget(int targetX,
                                                    int targetY)
        find a list of launch points, out of 24 possible ones in total, which can aim at the launch point
        Parameters:
        targetX - bin x
        targetY - bin y
        Returns:
        list of coordinates [0], [1], its corresponding angle [2] and distance adjustment in terms of TILE_SIZE[3]

      • setTarget

        public static void setTarget(int x,
             int y)
        reset the target tile of PATHFINDER (differs from the navigation target, which is the next tile)
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • isFacingAWall

        public static boolean isFacingAWall()
        whether the robot is directly facing a wall
        Returns:
        true if yes

      • resetLaunchPoint

        public static void resetLaunchPoint()
        resets the launch point to another which is not adjacent (lower left) to an obstacle

      • letsGoHome

        public static void letsGoHome()
        resets target to home corner

      • isAdjacentToObstacle

        public static boolean isAdjacentToObstacle(int x,
                           int y)
        checks whether a tile is adjacent to an obstacle on the West, South or Southwest tiles
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of tile
        y - y coordinate of tile
        Returns:
        true is adjacent
